screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .wat file in Microsoft Visual Studio Code 1.9
screenshot.caption: WAT file open in Microsoft Visual Studio Code 1.9

description: After compiling WAT files to WASM with a WebAssembly compiler, developers typically deploy them to run in web browsers, such as Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Edge, and Apple Safari, for games, media editing tools, data simulations, and more. WASM files may also run on server-side platforms like Node.js.

NOTE: The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) WebAssembly Community Group develops WAT as part of the WebAssembly (WASM) project (beginning in 2015). The group includes major contributors from Mozilla, Google, Microsoft, and Apple and independent developers.
